body.p: “The flower deserves a more particular description than Gray gives it. But Bigelow says well of its corolla that it is ‘remarkable for its distinct “,” five angled form.’ Its segments are a little recurved. The calyx-segments are acute and pink at last; the racemes “,” elongated “,” about one inch long “,” one-sided; the corolla “,” narrowed at the mouth “,” but very wide above; the calyx “,” with its segments “,” pedicels “,” and the whole raceme (and indeed the leaves somewhat) “,” glandular hairy.”
PE 12, pg. 375 / 2 April-31 July 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:29 / T vol. # XXIII / PDF # XV / JIX
